title.narrative: Core Funding to OCHA (Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs ) & Red Cross

description.narrative: Core funding to Ireland’s main UN humanitarian coordination partner, the Office for the coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), and core funding to the Red Cross Movement (International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) and International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC))

Under this budget line, Ireland will maintain the level of core funding to the main UN humanitarian coordination partner, the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). €2.9 million in core funding to OCHA is proposed in 2017. Under this budget line, Ireland will also continue to provide core funding to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), one of the most highly respected humanitarian agencies with an exceptional level of access to besieged or otherwise isolated populations in need of humanitarian assistance. It is proposed to keep our ICRC core contribution in 2017 at €9.5 million. Ireland will also continue core support to the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC). It is proposed to maintain core funding to IFRC in line with the 2016 level of €1.6 million.
